means: 圣餐，（经过祝圣的）圣餐面包（及酒）

sentence.Network_en: The priest blessed the bread and wine, ie before the celebration of the Eucharist.
sentence.Network_cn: 牧师先将饼和酒圣洁化, 然后开始圣餐仪式.

sentence.Network_en: Communion in the Eucharist does not destroy but affirms diversity and otherness.
sentence.Network_cn: 圣餐中的共融并不摧毁万物的多样性与他性,反而肯定他们的多样性与他性.

sentence.Network_en: The sacrament of the Eucharist received by a congregation.
sentence.Network_cn: 圣餐某地区全体教徒接受圣餐的圣礼.

entry.tran: 圣餐仪式，圣餐礼（纪念耶稣最后晚餐的仪式，仪式上要吃面包、喝葡萄酒）
entry.def: The Eucharist is the Christian religious ceremony in which Christ's last meal with his disciples is celebrated by eating bread and drinking wine.

means.word_mean: 1. a Christian sacrament commemorating the Last Supper by consecrating bread and wine

auth_sentence.content: Some practising Catholics may receive the Eucharist every day.
auth_sentence.res_content: Some practising Catholics may receive the Eucharist every day.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Some practising Catholics may receive the Eucharist every day.

auth_sentence.content: Churches also differ in how often they receive the Eucharist.
auth_sentence.res_content: Churches also differ in how often they receive the Eucharist.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Churches also differ in how often they receive the Eucharist.

auth_sentence.content: For Roman Catholics, the Eucharist is the most important act of worship.
auth_sentence.res_content: For Roman Catholics, the Eucharist is the most important act of worship.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: For Roman Catholics, the Eucharist is the most important act of worship.
